alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, southwestern Clarendon, southwestern Sumter and southeastern Orangeburg Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Elloree to 6 miles west of Holly Hill. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Manning, Holly Hill, Summerton, Elloree, Santee State Park, Santee Cooper Regional Airport, Santee, Pinewood, Eutawville, Paxville, Vance, Poplar Creek Landing, Rimini, Stumphole Landing, Eautaw Springs, Blounts Landing, Lone Star, Low Falls Landing, St. Paul and Rocks Pond Campground and Marina. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 167 and 168. Interstate 95 between mile markers 86 and 119. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
